poem:
**An Economy at Ease**

Morning numbers flicker,
the pulse of trade slackens
like a calm breath.
2.5% they say, in soft voices,
a coolness in the room
where coins have stilled their dance.
Charts neither climb nor fall,
the world pauses, a held breath,
waiting for the next uncertain exhale.

Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
